title: What to Know About New York’s Midterm Elections
description: The state has become a bellwether for both parties, with significant congressional seats in play and an increasingly close governor’s race.
dc:creator: Michael Gold

media:content.media:credit: Gabby Jones for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Early voting in New York begins on Saturday, Oct. 29, and ends Sunday, Nov. 6, two days before Election Day.
